issue.title: Installation From Conda
issue.body:
## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe. While I was browsing through the docs I found out that there isn't any instructions regarding how to install the graspologic library in conda environment. As sometimes installing via pip in conda environment causes an environment error( as it is in the case of streamlit) so a separate set of instructions for installing graspologic through conda is highly appreciated. ## Describe the solution you'd like As earlier we were able to install graspy in conda through the conda-forge option. So I was wondering if we could add instructions to install graspologic in conda wither via conda forge or by creating a virtual environment it will be better for users. ## Describe alternatives you've considered Instructions to install Graspologic either by virtual env or by conda forge ## Provide references (if applicable) Here is the instrcutions on how to install graspy via conda forge.
https://anaconda.org/conda-forge/graspy ## Additional context Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

body: Lemme try and check if I am able to reproduce the same error

@loftusa When I tried your code into google Colaboratory I didn't faced any such error here is the screen shot attached for reference.
![Screenshot (660)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53184883/107137812-1d8f1980-6936-11eb-9d82-7fd8a5fcb835.png)

but when I try the same thing in jupyter notebook I am getting an error in installing the graspologic but when I installed it via command prompt it was successfully installed without any warning or errors.
![Screenshot (661)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53184883/107137818-297adb80-6936-11eb-945f-c5aea96252ce.png)
![Screenshot (662)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53184883/107137823-2e3f8f80-6936-11eb-9712-e95c08a62323.png)
I don't know if it just in my system or not @bdpedigo @loftusa

hmm @rajpratyush I just pip uninstalled and then reinstalled, and now I'm getting the same list you are.
I do notice that `nominate` is still missing in both of our installations.

Not sure why my `dir` was messed up before -- @bdpedigo could you try?

EDIT: I'm wondering if I was just dumb and didn't have the current version of graspologic installed, but I remember that the reason I noticed this is that there was a mismatch between the modules in my local `graspologic` directory and the ones that came up with `dir` (and I always install with `pip install -e .`)
does look like nominate was never added here https://github.com/microsoft/graspologic/blob/dev/graspologic/__init__.py
well I installed with pip install graspologic lemme see again if I get nominate this time or not. but why is I am not able to install graspologic in jupyter notebook

> well I installed with pip install graspologic lemme see again if I get nominate this time or not. but why is I am not able to install graspologic in jupyter notebook

Looks like some `llvmlite` conflict? Try `pip uninstall llvmlite`

I also recommend installing graspologic by going to its root directory (so that `setup.py` is in your working directory) and using `pip install -e .`. That'll install the current working version, and auto-implement any changes you make to it, so that you can test stuff you change without reinstalling the package.
I guess close? although still don't know why this happened on my end yesterday, so best to keep our eyes open
I vote close unless we have a simple reproducible example of the bug
Well lemme try it today if it happens againor not
